name: Format\DataTable
description: The component for adding a JSON data table.

properties.name: data
properties.description: An object that provides data for the table. This property also provides information about the data, such as data types and header labels, in the form of the data descriptor.

properties.name: anchor
properties.description: An object that defines vertical alignment with another component.

properties.name: animation
properties.description:
An object that defines an animation to be applied to the component.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: behavior
properties.description:
An object that defines behavior for a component, like  or .
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.

properties.name: conditional
properties.description: An instance or array of component properties that can be applied conditionally, and the conditions that cause them to be applied.

properties.name: dataOrientation
properties.description:
A string value that determines the table orientation. 
Valid values:

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the component is hidden.

properties.name: identifier
properties.description: An optional unique identifier for this component. If used, this identifier must be unique across the entire document. You will need an identifier for your component if you want to anchor other components to it.

properties.name: layout
properties.description:
An inline ComponentLayout object that contains layout information, or a string reference to a ComponentLayout object that is defined at the top level of the document. 
If layout is not defined, size and position will be based on various factors, such as the device type, the length of the content, and the role of this component.

properties.name: showDescriptorLabels
properties.description: A Boolean value that determines whether the headers are shown. If true, the headers are visible, with the labels defined in the . If false, the headers are not visible.

properties.name: sortBy
properties.description:
An array that determines how table data is sorted. Rules are applied in the order in which they are provided in the array.
If this property is not defined, data records are displayed in the order in which they are provided in the data .

properties.name: style
properties.description:
An inline ComponentStyle object that defines the appearance of this component or a string reference to a ComponentStyle object that is defined at the top level of the document.
If this property is omitted, the table is styled according to a component style called default-datatable. If default-datatable doesn’t exist or doesn’t define table styling, the table is styled according to a component style called default. If no table styling is defined in any of these places, Apple News uses its built-in default table styling.
The none value is used for conditional design elements. Adding it here has no effect.
